Yossarian

Oh I step on 'em alright, but only after I've taught 'em a lesson first: Texas-style!
 
 First, I put little black bags over their furry caterpilleroid heads. (Use Barbie's Evening Magic slippers, they're the perfect size.) Then, I strap them down with 10lb. Gorilla fishing line, to an awkward frame bent from paper clips. It's best to leave 'em there for a day or so, let 'em start to realize just who they've messed with.
 About the time they're screaming in agony, tiny caterpillar muscles spasming and contorting in pain, is when the real fun begins.
 I gather 'em all together in a pile, and make 'em do nasty, sex-type stuff with each other, like make 'em re-enact scenes from wishy-washy liberal Broadway shows and whatnot. Sometimes I'll harness me up a Preying Mantis, and let 'im just sit there and...Prey at 'em, real evil- and hungry-like, so's they know I could just let him go any time I wanna, and he'd eat 'em up.
 I take lotsa fotergraffs. I like takin' fotergraffs.
 Sometimes, too, I shock 'em with little 9-volt batteries. You ever stick one o' them things on your tongue? Whoo! Damn that smarts, don't it? Imagine how them caterpillars feel, when their hair starts burnin' and their little legs get ta tappin'! emoticon_xdonno

Or how about Man Of La Mancha? Those are the best. Or how about Joseph And The Amazing Technocolored Dreamcoat? That was always my favorite as a little kid.
